hopobject.body:
Quick list of BeagleBone projects I saw at World Maker Faire in New York

There wasn't enough time to really discover all of the BeagleBone Black projects at World Maker Faire in New York. I did post some quick pictures on Google+, but I barely had time to breathe at the Faire!

  • OpenROV - Open hardware underwater robot
  • Hoboken MakerBar Orbital Rendersphere - Spinning persistence of vision globe
  • GrannyCam - Video chat for Grandma/Grandkids
  • Matt Mets' Crystal Gateway - Sculpture covered in LEDs
  • Tempo Automation Electronics Factory - Desktop electronics manufacturing robot
  • BBot - BeagleBone + FPGA remote control robot
  • Logi-family - FPGA development cape for BeagleBone Black
  • TinyG - Motion control board adds web interface through BeagleBone Black
  • RAMPS adapter cape - Connect a CNC or RAMPS controller to BeagleBone Black

There were also at least 10 talks that had some coverage of BeagleBone Black! Makers are discovering what out-of-box software, a higher-performance processor running Linux, a great set of low-level hardware interfaces supported by high-levle software and on-board dedicated-to-real-time microcontrollers can do for them!
